body_html:
Compared to the repr of lists and numpy arrays, that is an extra space. The first element of an array has no space in its string repr, and there should be just one space after the comma. It should be "1" + ", " + "2" rather than putting a space before each element rather than a single space after the comma.

Ultimately, this isn't terribly important, but it does make reading arrays feel a bit off (to me anyway).

Compared to the repr of lists and numpy arrays, that is an extra space. The first element of an array has no space in its string repr, and there should be just one space after the comma. It should be "1" + ", " + "2" rather than putting a space before each element rather than a single space after the comma.
Ultimately, this isn't terribly important, but it does make reading arrays feel a bit off (to me anyway).
body:
Compared to the repr of lists and numpy arrays, that is an extra space. The first element of an array has no space in its string repr, and there should be just one space after the comma. It should be `"1" + ", " + "2"` rather than putting a space before each element rather than a single space after the comma.

Ultimately, this isn't terribly important, but it does make reading arrays feel a bit *off* (to me anyway).
